definition: non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out

sentences.english: Cause, shucks, us snakes ain't got it bad.
sentences.chinese: 原因，胡说，我们没有得到蛇是它坏。

sentences.english: Jack began to buff and puff when asked awkward question.
sentences.chinese: 要是问到棘手的问题，杰克就开始颠三倒四地胡说。
全是胡说八道，我写的东西。

sentences.english: Don't run your mind games on me, that's my number! What's this bozo 's name?
sentences.chinese: 别对我胡说八道，这是我的号码，那家伙叫什么名字？

sentences.english: When I left he was still drivelling on about his popularity in school.
sentences.chinese: 当我离开时他还在喋喋不休地胡说他在学校的声望。

sentences.english: Her silly talk verged on nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 她的蠢话近乎胡说八道。

sentences.english: Or as my younger son would say, fudge knuckle.
sentences.chinese: 或者像我的小儿子会说的一样，胡说八道。

sentences.english: I don't know what b. s. you guys are saying lol.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你们在胡说八道什么。

sentences.english: The idea that some cigarettes are healthier than others is a whole lot of malarkey .
sentences.chinese: 有些香烟比其它香烟更健康的这种想法全是胡说八道。

sentences.english: I pray you, sir, what saucy merchant was this, that was so full of his ropery?
sentences.chinese: 先生，这个满嘴胡说八道的放肆家伙是谁？

sentences.english: "You do talk rot. " he said crossly.
This is what its members claim. It's nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 这是其成员的话，简直是胡说八道。

sentences.english: That stupid television speaker is drivelling on again !
sentences.chinese: 那个愚蠢的电视又在喋喋不休地胡说了。

sentences.english: Give him the flapdoodle with the right because he don't know.
sentences.chinese: 给他胡说的权利，因为他不懂。

sentences.english: Midwives must reach the babbling fool status before you foal out.
sentences.chinese: 助产士必须满了你的小马驹在胡说傻瓜地位。

definition: to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to spit blood (idiom); venomous slander/malicious attacks
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to make false accusations against sb (idiom)
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
